resources.string: This is the most beautiful place...

Połonina Wetlińska is total amazing place to go. You can admire the beautiful views, spanning across both Polish and Ukrainian landscapes. Find mountain hut “Chatka Puchatka”. Chatka Puchatka means Winnie the Pooh’s hut in Polish.
"Połonina" in Polish means an accumulation of grasslands above border of the forest. Mountains. Hike on those bare peaks is the biggest attraction!
Otryt is a wild mountain range, at the heart of Bieszczady.
Wołosaty is a left tributary of the San River. In summer there is possibility to lie on the beach or take some rafting on pontoon.
Tworylne was an old lemko village. Now only one hause is lived.

Orthodox church in Smolnik near San – originally Greek-Catholic church of Saint Michael the Archangel, it is the oldest and most beautiful church architecture in Bieszczady. Wooden Orthodox Churches in the Bieszczady Mountains are one of the most characteristic and recognizable symbols of the region.
Beniowa is an old Lemko village. Only old lime remember how it looks like.
Lipie is an old Lemko village. Now only one house is lived.

There is some examples of trekking tour.\n Ustrzyki Gorne - Szeroki Wierch - Tarnica - Halicz - Rozsypaniec - Bukowska Pass - Wolosate (about 8 h). Walk along one of the most scenic routes in Bieszczady mountain, on the Ukraine border, up to Tarnica (1346 m) - the highest peak of Bieszczady range mountain.
Dark sky parks are the last places in the urbanised world where you can still see the stars. The sky over the Bieszczady is absolutely one of its kind.
Do you recognize the bird on the picture? ... Watch the rich birdlife including Ural Owl, rare Woodpeckers and Eagles.
Solina lake is not natural but very beatiful place... You can visit to the dam and water reservoirs. Also is possible to take the boat trip trough Solina Lake.
Go tracking Bison, Bears, Wolves and Lynx with a local expert.
In Bieszczady you can find different kinds of honey ...
Ursa maior is faumos brand from Bieszczady ...
In july you can go for a walk and find ...
